title.text: HELPFUL ANSWERS TO MODAL AND tlYPOTHETICAL QUESTIONS

abstractContent.text: University of Essex England emaih derce@uk.ac.essex (janet) 1.0 ABSTRACT, This paper describes a computational pragmatic model which is geared towards providing helpful answers to modal and hypothetical questions.

entities.text: University of Essex England emaih derce@uk.ac.essex (janet) 1.0

abstractContent.text: The work brings together elements from fonnal.

semantic theories on modality m~d question answering, defines a wkler, pragmatically flavoured, notion of answerhood based on non-monotonic inference aod develops a notion of context, within which aspects of more cognitively oriented theories, such as Relevance Theory, can be accommodated.
The research was fundexl by ESRC grant number R000231279.
